modifications.modifiedDescription: Choose a card in your draw pile. NL Give it Exhaust and play it twice. NL Exhaust.
Enter Divinity. NL At the start of your next turn, take 99999 damage. NL Exhaust.
modifications.modifiedUpgradedDescription: Retain. NL Enter Divinity. NL At the start of your next turn, take 99999 damage. NL Exhaust.

tooltips.title: Spoon Omniscience
tooltips.content:
When Omniscience is played, it gives the selected card exhaust, plays the card and then plays a copy of that card. Thus, the card played by Omniscience can be prevented from being exhausted by Strange Spoon. 
However, after the card is played by Omniscience, it still has Exhaust, so when you play that card again, it can be exhausted. Powers or cards that exhaust can still be played twice.

tooltips.title: Blasphemy
tooltips.content:
Blasphemy originally reads "die next turn". However, the effect is actually "at the start of your next turn, take 99999 damage". The "die next turn" effect is a Power and not a debuff, thus it cannot be blocked by artefact or removed by Orange Pellets. 
Instead, you can prevent the 99999 damage by having a stack of Intangible or Buffer next turn to block the hit.

tooltips.title: Vault
tooltips.content:
Vault ends your turn and then lets you take another turn, taking another turn activates all end of turn and start of turn effects such as Establishment, Battle Hymn or Mercury Hourglass and increments turn counting relics such as Happy Flower and Incense Burner. 
If Vault is played against Time Eater after you have played 11 cards, Time Eater's turn is ended instead, but it still gains strength.

tooltips.title: Dual Wield Ritual Dagger
tooltips.content:
When you Dual Wield a Ritual Dagger, all copies of the Ritual Dagger (including the original) do not increase the card's damage when you land a fatal kill, likely due to a bug. 
However, this does not happen if you do not use the card selection menu (when it is the only attack and power card in your hand). In this case, the original dagger increases the card's damage when a fatal is landed.

tooltips.title: Spoon Havoc
tooltips.content: Cards played by Havoc can be saved by Strange Spoon.

tooltips.title: Free Focus
tooltips.content:
The second part of Biased Cognition, where you lose 1 Focus at the start of your turn, is considered a debuff. If you have artefact before you play the card, the debuff will not be applied. 
However, artefact gained after the card is played will not remove the debuff, as artefact only prevents future debuffs. Though losing focus is a debuff as well, so artefact gained after the card is played can preserve one turn worth of focus.

tooltips.title: Free Focus
tooltips.content: The second part of Biased Cognition, where you lose 1 Focus at the start of your turn, is considered a debuff. Thus you can remove it with Orange Pellets.
